results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Description: 

Shift5 is seeking a full-time Product Manager, with a specific focus on our DoD customers, to join our growing team. In this role, you’ll have an opportunity to make an immediate impact on real world operations and problems we’re solving for our customers. You’ll learn about capability gaps in existing defense platforms, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build the product infrastructure to support our goals. Your primary responsibilities will be to act as the voice of the customer while supporting our product vision and strategy.

We are looking for someone who thrives while working in partnership with engineers, designers, and other stakeholders. The ability to translate complex technical scenarios into simplified stories and requirements is absolutely essential for this role. We operate in a fast-paced environment with competing and evolving priorities and you’ll be expected to do the same. The ideal candidate for this position is someone who is comfortable living in ambiguity and can self prioritize and self direct daily tasks and requirements. If this sounds like you, drop us a line because we’d love to hear from you.

Shift5 is a rapidly growing data and cybersecurity scale-up. We specialize in capturing and analyzing serial bus data in real time, providing anomaly detection and operational intelligence required to act. Our insights provide real-time alerting and historical trends to assure mission readiness and cyber survivability, and our innovative technology enables military systems to deter adversaries, protect warfighters, and maintain their competitive edge. We are a collaborative, passionate and driven cadre of cyber security experts. Our engineers are multidisciplinary, and our team is dynamic. We’re a growing company focused on helping our customer’s fleets run smarter and safer by capitalizing on mountains of data resting right about the wheels. Come join us.

In this role you will be expected to:

  • Identify, explore and learn about gaps in defense capabilities, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build a product infrastructure to support our goals
  • Define solutions
  • Identify and define potential features that will accelerate Shift5’s goals
  • Set clear outcomes for your area of responsibility in partnership with  engineering, design and other key stakeholders
  • Effectively communicate product vision and strategy
  • Proactively communicate goals to stakeholders and manage delivery expectations
  • Work hands-on to deliver new capabilities across the lifecycle of the product, from initial release and implementation, through up-keep and day to day improvements
  • Collaborate with Sales and Marketing to communicate product capabilities to customers and other key stakeholders

We're looking for someone who is/has:

  • BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or you’re technically savvy enough to ask engineers good questions about architecture decisions and understand the answers
  • 3+ years experience implementing and/or supporting software development or enterprise network capabilities, with specific experience in a hands-on product management role
  • Demonstrated ability to work with internal and external stakeholders across a wide range of technical comfort
  • Demonstrated experience turning conflicting or incomplete ideas into concrete action plans
  • At least a baseline understanding and experience working with DoD platforms and systems, experience within DoD fleet maintenance is a plus
  • Experience and understanding of non standard network serial protocols such as MIL STD-1553, J-1939, CANBUS and/or ARINC 429, is a huge plus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.
  • US Citizenship
  • Active (or ability to hold/obtain) a US Government Top Secret security clearance

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and stock options in a fast-growing startup
  • Employer-paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their families
  • Health Savings Account with annual employer contributions
  • 401k with employer contributions
  • Employer-paid Life Insurance
  • Uncapped paid time off policy
  • Flexible work & remote work policy
  • Tax-deferred public transit benefits with Metro SmartBenefits (DC/MD/VA)

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that embraces the diversity of our people and represents the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems. We strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. 

Shift5 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, marital status, ancestry, projected veteran status, or any other protected group or class.

results.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About us

Qualio is on a mission to empower life science teams to launch and scale life-saving products. We’re doing that by building a connected and integrated quality management platform for the entire life science ecosystem. Qualio is trusted by 100s of highly regulated international customers, ranging from the bleeding edge of computational biology and machine learning to household names in mRNA vaccine development. 

The Qualio team is an all-remote, globally distributed workforce with teammates in over ten countries.

What’s the opportunity? 

Make a significant impact in a company helping improve lives by enabling teams to launch and scale quality health sciences products. The mission of product marketing is to learn from customers, the market, partners, the sales team, customer success teams, and the rest of Qualio and then build out and refine the positioning, messaging and content that educates partners, prospects and customers on how Qualio meets their needs. You will work closely with the sales, customer success, product and partners to understand what content helps drive acceleration along the customer journey. 

Join Qualio and help companies discover a better way to manage the quality of their products.

What will I be doing? 
  • Craft and own the communication around the business value proposition, working with internal and external stakeholders as well as technical and non-technical audiences
  • Develop and coordinate marketing strategies
  • Strong collaboration with Product, Sales, Customer Success and other Marketing teams
  • Publicly launch new products and features to our partners and channels delivering messaging that communicates the product’s value 
  • Develop partner and market-facing assets including collateral, data sheets, white papers, videos, presentations and selling tools across a wide range of quality and regulatory topics
  • Work closely with demand generation to create amazing prospects experiences and customer journeys
  • Bring customer stories to life through content that will resonate with our target audience
  • Speak or present at industry events or webinars when needed
  • Monitors markets for emerging trends to identify opportunities/challenges
  • Support sales by driving competitive intelligence
  • Build an engaged community/following to establish Qualio as a thought leader and influencer in quality management for life sciences
What skills do I need? 
  • Strong product marketing experience in a B2B software environment
  • Strong ability to influence and work cross-functionally 
  • Excellent writer and storyteller - ability to articulate, in written and spoken forms internally and externally, the long-term vision and also help sales and marketing communicate value of Qualio
  • Product and market expertise - Prior experience in a related field is a bonus, but you’ll need to demonstrate the ability to learn and grow
  • Ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects
  • Strong analytical aptitude to analyze customer data in order to find commonalities, trends, and stories that can be used in marketing and to make strategy decisions
  • Able to perform under pressure, prioritize and deliver results in a demanding and fast-paced environment that requires fresh thinking and innovation
  • A demonstrated history of being a team player, and desire to jump in and get your hands dirty as needed.
Benefits 

In addition to playing an important role in building Qualio, you'll receive:

  • Competitive salary
  • Matching 401k
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Unlimited PTO (minimum of 15 days/year)
  • Professional development budget
  • Co-working space allowance or home office budget
  • Company retreats 
  • 12-weeks fully paid parental leave
  • Opportunity to make a difference through helping life-saving products to get to market
A note to candidates:

Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described.

results.title: Field Marketing Manager
results.description:
Acquia is the open digital experience company. We provide the world's most ambitious brands with products built around Drupal to allow them to embrace innovation and create customer moments that matter. At Acquia, we believe in the power of community and collaboration — giving our customers and partners the freedom to build tomorrow on their terms.

Headquartered in the U.S., we have been named one of North America’s fastest growing software companies by Deloitte and Inc. Magazine, rated a leader by the analyst community, and named one of the Best Places to Work by the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future and we want you to be a part of it!

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Field Marketing Manager to support our sales team in North America. As a Field Marketing Manager, you will be part of an entrepreneurial team in a rapidly growing business with your role in marketing focused on driving enterprise pipeline growth. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, development of field marketing strategies and plans, event management and execution, partner co-marketing, pipeline acceleration initiatives, and adaptation of lead generation campaigns targeted at the Enterprise and Mid-Market size businesses and the Public Sector..

  • Drive new and creative lead generation activities including events (virtual/hybrid/in-person), direct marketing, webinars, collateral and customer case studies.

  • Ability to craft great collateral and structure and write compelling marketing copy for campaigns.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to earn trust and respect from sales management.
  • Experience with sales operations, reporting, marketing & campaign dashboards and KPIs.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders in a fast moving environment.
  • Willingness to travel.

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
SUMMARY

As a Product Owner in our Client Delivery team you will define, prioritize, and evaluate the work based on Client requirements for new implementations, change requests and maintenance upgrades to optimize the business value delivered by your scrum team. You will work with subject matter experts at our customers and within Vestmark to develop the user stories for product enhancements and oversee product enhancements throughout the development lifecycle.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS*

  • Participate in discovery alongside key stakeholders ensuring a significant understanding of requirements to share with the development team.
  • Partner with Products to understand new features
  • Coordinate, facilitate and/or conduct as needed demonstrations
  • Manage Change Request assignments with the scrum team and ascertain priority and timing expectations with the client/RM
  • Manage upgrades and maintenance releases with scrum team
  • Work with internal/external client teams to document business requirements
  • Write internal/external user stories and acceptance criteria and conduct walkthroughs as needed
  • Refine user stories with the scrum team
  • Establish priorities, collaborating with client or internal relationship managers when needed
  • Prioritize interruptions against sprint work
  • Maintain scrum team backlog
  • Creating & Maintaining epics for projects
  • Owning the status of an epic and ensuring they are closed when work is complete
  • Strive to have 1-3 future sprints planned
  • Work with scrum master to resolve impediments preventing team from meeting sprint goals
  • Be available for adhoc questions raised by the scrum team
  • Testing on adhoc basis as needed

PREPARATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Experience: 3+ years’ experience as a Product Owner or Business Analyst with knowledge of Agile process and principles
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Financial industry knowledge, particularly in the areas of portfolio management, portfolio accounting, or trading operations
  • Familiarity with the data associated with the processing of securities, transactions, and positions of either retail or institutional portfolios
  • Experience with software delivery
  • Enterprise software company experience or experience in a professional services organization delivering enterprise software used by financial services organizations
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong and effective customer service skills
  • Bright with a high degree of initiative to learn and work collaboratively to solve problems
  • Do what it takes attitude, displaying positive energy even in challenging situations
  • Strong communication skills; able to respond and exchange ideas clearly and effectively through writing, speaking, and presentations; shares appropriate information to keep people informed

COMPETENCIES

  • Teamwork – We before me-- Puts needs of team first and aspires to bring out the best in others; collaborative, empathetic and humble; values the opinions of others; assists others when needed; participates effectively as member of a team; balances personal contributions and needs with those of other members of the team to achieve common objectives.
  • Knowledge Explorer – Creative problem solver and adapts to challenges at hand using creative collaboration; curious, proactive and resourceful; able to incorporate other viewpoints as part of the process of developing solutions
  • Positive Energy – Ability to address difficult situations with humor and sense of opportunity; approachable, constructive and engaged
  • Own It- Empathetic and accountable until the end.

WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Willingness to travel occasionally on as needed basis. 

BENEFITS

  • Vestmark pays 90% of Medical and Dental insurance premium
  • Vestmark sponsored Life, STD, and LTD Benefits
  • Generous PTO
  • Company equity in the form of Restricted Stock Units
  • 401(k) with Employer Matching
  • Employee Assistance Program

 

Vestmark is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Vestmark prohibits employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability status, protected military or veteran status, and genetic information.

This role cannot be performed by a resident of New York City, NY.

results.title: Content Creator, Privacy Not Included
results.description:
The Mozilla Foundation’s award-winning *Privacy Not Included project (PNI) is seeking an individual to support the creation of consumer-facing, web-based content to help consumers understand the privacy + security of their technology.

As a result of your work, people who use, but don’t always understand the privacy and security of technology, will feel empowered to buy products that align with their values. Your content will appear in a variety of online mediums (news articles, research publications, emails, blogs, social media and original long-form content) and reach millions of people. We are not seeking a writer with only technological know-how; instead, our ideal candidate would excel at storytelling and writing engaging content that is informative but also humorous, accessible, and easy-to-read.

Working with the *PNI Lead and Researcher, the Content Creator will be responsible for:

  • Writing, editing and fact checking *Privacy Not Included product reviews and publications; see privacynotincluded.org
  • Drafting original content in various formats that cover topics related to the *Privacy Not Included project and advised through research + interviews
  • Developing content that tells a story with a consistent and cohesive voice, and is aligned with the Mozilla and Privacy Not Included brand
  • Maintaining an editorial calendar for *Privacy Not Included content that feeds into the broader Mozilla Foundation editorial calendar
  • Creating and maintaining a system of cataloging *Privacy Not Included content to ensure timely updating and sharing of content as relevant
  • Collaborating with Marketing team colleagues to identify and leverage audience and SEO insights into content ideas
  • Collaborating with Marketing team colleagues to develop *Privacy Not Included content graphics and publication timelines for news articles, social media posts, blog posts, and other long-form content
Required Qualifications
  • 4 years experience writing and creating consumer-facing web content
  • 2+ years’ experience as an effective web-based content creator with a digital storytelling approach.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail.
  • Proven ability to present complex information in a clear and concise way.
  • Proven track record to quickly learn and understand complex topics.
  • A basic understanding of technology, including privacy/security principles and their potential impact on people/communities
  • Proven track record as a strong collaborator and communicator with colleagues across different departments.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and to work independently.
  • Experience working in a distributed organization, preferably a remote-first workplace.
  • Alignment with Mozilla mission and *Privacy Not Included project goals

results.title: Product Marketing Director, GovCon ERP
results.description:
The Product Marketing Director will define and enable Unanet’s Go-To-Market Strategy for our ERP solution for Government Contractors (GovCon) and work with our Director of CRM on aligning our CRM story, message and integration between ERP and CRM for GovCon. This is an outstanding opportunity to develop marketing-problem-oriented messaging, positioning and to be the public voice of our ERP solution to internal and external audiences.

What You’ll Do

  • Be the clear and enthusiastic voice of the customer and market for the GovCon market
  • Lead and excite cross functional groups, in particular sales, about the market opportunity and how we uniquely solve it
  • Create a solution-based story that you use to enable sales, the company, and the market
  • Understand and continuously develop understanding of Unanet’s portfolio of products; translate technical features into messages that resonate with the broader market
  • Present at company and industry events as a thought leader and a product expert
  • Create and execute Go-to-Market (GTM) strategy and plans
  • Define buyer personas, needs and map to the buyer journey
  • Develop differentiated, value-based messaging in the language of the buyer for a variety of communication channels
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in the planning and execution of successful product launches
  • Assist in the development and delivery of sales enablement materials, including but not limited to presentations, playbooks, and scripts
  • Understand the competitive landscape and develop competitive intelligence tools to support sales and marketing programs
  • Collaborate closely with Product Management to influence the product roadmap, understand product updates, do competitive analysis, and enable sales
  • Create a content strategy and work with the extended marketing team on executing key thought leadership and content for example, eBooks, webinars, and presentations at events
  • Track and analyze the effectiveness of product marketing activities through the measurement of key metrics
  • Collaborate with other product marketing managers on the team to create vertical based stories to bring to market
  • Hone product marketing skills to be an example of industry excellence

First 90 days

  • In your first 30 days, you will become familiar with our customers, products, the industries we serve, and our approach to marketing, sales, and customer success. You will immerse yourself in product education, working closely with colleagues to learn about our people and the processes that make Unanet run.
  • In your first 60 days, you will establish relationships, trust and rapport with the product marketing team, product management and sales, as well as others across our company. You will manage the launches with product management and prepare enablement sessions for company readiness.
  • In your first 90 days, you have a strong understanding of our market and product offerings. You are able to speak and write credibly about our solutions with customers and prospects. You will have established yourself as the go-to person, leader and problem solver on all things GovCon ERP product marketing.

  Who You Are

  • 7+ years of product marketing experience in B2B software
  • Experience with Pragmatic Marketing principals
  • Proficiency with business productivity applications, preferably in the GovCon industry
  • Demonstrable analytical experience used to markedly improve customer development, product adoption, and sales process via relevant metrics (e.g., Content Effectiveness, Win Rate, Market Penetration)
  • Experience performing research and building competitive analyses, as well as presenting to a diverse Sales organization
  • Clear and succinct written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to travel to customer and/or partner sites, conferences, or other field events, as well as quarterly working sessions

Differentiators

  • MBA
  • Experience in a high-growth B2B software environment
  • Experience in the Government Contracting industries

 Our Values

  • We are a Team. Employees, customers, and partners working together.
  • We are Customer-Focused. Customers are the heart of everything we do.
  • We are Driven. Seeking exceptional outcomes.
  • We Own our Success. Every employee has a stake in our company.
  • We do the right thing and have fun in the process.

The salary range for this opportunity is $140,000 - $155,000 per year. You will be eligible for discretionary bonus compensation, subject to plans that may be in effect from time to time. You will further be eligible to participate in Unanet’s employee benefits plans and programs. For more details on Unanet’s benefits offerings, please visit https://unanet.com/employee-benefits

results.title: Director, Product
results.description:
Loyal is an organization centered on experience and building a platform that allows consumers to make meaningful decisions when it comes to healthcare. We deeply understand providers, locations, services, appointments, business rules, and moreover, we understand patients -- who they are, the preferred method of communication, upcoming appointments, lapsed appointments, outstanding bills, health risks, and more. With this intelligence, our platform fuels highly relevant and personalized experiences across all mediums (website, email, voice…) allowing patients to get healthy, stay healthy, and have a better relationship with the health care provider.

**This is a remote role**

Job Summary 

The Director, Product role is responsible for product planning, strategy and execution for our Digital Front Door and Shared Services division of products. Products in this division include, but are not limited to; Conversational AI, Web Search, Web Scheduling, Data Management, EHR Integrations, and Portal Services. 

The Director, Product is responsible for defining the vision for the division and collaborating with other leaders from the engineering, marketing, sales, and operations departments to ensure that financial, customer, and user satisfaction goals are met. This role will also work closely with other Director, Product roles to ensure effective and efficient cross-division coordination. Most importantly, this role is responsible for coaching and growing the product managers within the division.

Job Duties 

  • Develop long term strategy, vision and high-level priorities for your product team(s) in alignment with company priorities
  • Continuously engage customers to gain insight into customer needs and represent Loyal’s products
  • Practice effective internal and external communication, ensuring that priorities, high-profile metrics, and projects are well communicated and well understood
  • Partner with Engineering and Design to foster empowered product delivery teams operating effectively at all levels 
  • Collaborate with Leadership, Marketing, Customer Success, and other functional areas to gain new insights, unlock opportunities, and work together more effectively, with a specific focus on enabling go-to-market strategies.
  • Manage cross-team dynamics to ensure the entire team is successful, proactively instituting process improvements across your team, e.g., review and provide feedback on roadmaps, strategic plans and feature specs
  • Coach team members to use modern, effective, and data-driven product management practices to de-risk decisions and create value 
  • Plan the structure of your team, managing headcount, succession planning, external hires and internal transfers 
  • Motivate your team to ensure they are engaged and connected to the larger company mission

Education and Experience

  • 7+ years of technology product management experience
  • 3+ years of experience managing people 
  • Experience working in the healthcare technology space preferred
  • Strong preference for experience integrating with EHRs
  • Experience working within a software as a service (SaaS) company preferred
  • Experience working within a start-up and/or ambiguous environment, with proven experience to be adaptable preferred

 

Knowledge and Skills

  • Management: You have directly managed a team of product managers
  • Execution: You have led multiple product teams which are able to execute consistently, delivering quality projects of the broadest scope and impact on time
  • UX: You are passionate about creating intuitive, simple user experiences.  You have a strong eye for usability and quality design.  You are a strong partner to and advocate for design

results.title: Risk Product Manager
results.description:
Who we are

Sendwave is on a mission to make sending funds to loved ones as easy and affordable as sending a text. What makes us stand out in a sea of similar apps? We deeply care about the diasporas and communities we serve — and that comes with a sense of connection to the markets we operate in. We strive to make life better for everyone who touches our product. That means recognizing and honoring the human experience behind sending money. We do that by remaining fee-free in most of our markets and offering round-the-clock customer care.

Our app is currently available in the United States, United Kingdom, Canada, and parts of Europe, and sends funds to 19 receiving countries for over 500,000 users. We currently have a 4.6-star rating on Trustpilot — people put their faith in us to deliver their money quickly, securely, and affordably. And we’re pretty darn proud of that.

How we work

What we’re most proud of though is our brilliant, creative, and tenacious team. Our remote-first workplace means you’ll be working with Sendwavers in Europe, Africa, South America, and the U.S. that all share a core set of Sendwave values. What exactly are those values? Glad you asked.

  1. Prioritize fearlessly.
     There will always be more problems to solve and opportunities to pursue than we have the capacity for. We’re not afraid to say no and are willing to let fires burn, knowing that to win we must discern and execute decisively on the vital few rather than the important many.
  2. Take full ownership of the outcomes we’re responsible for.
    Our job is not to do what we can to solve a problem. It's to ensure that problem is solved. If an attempt to solve a problem doesn't work, we seek an alternative. If we need help, we request it, and, if necessary, demand it.
  3. Forge a diverse team and inclusive culture.
    We believe the challenges we’re addressing will be best met by a truly global, diverse team, working together. We’re not naive to the systemic bias and discrimination that make this easier said than done, so we check our egos, listen deeply, and measure progress towards making this a fundamental part of our success.
  4. Maximize our rate of learning.
    We view projects as ever-evolving drafts and welcome opportunities to discover that what we had in mind won't work so we can move to an even better end state. Most importantly, we do this fast. The faster we run these loops — as a company and individuals — the faster we’ll achieve our mission.
  5. Embrace embarrassing honesty from ourselves and others.
    We function best when we're open and honest with one another — especially about our challenges and doubts. We lean into uncomfortable conversations and support our colleagues when they do the same.
  6. Maximize energy, not time spent.
    We measure our own and others’ contributions by objectives reached, not time spent. Living a full life outside of work is necessary for high achievement over the long term.

 

How you’ll help us achieve it

If you’ve ever seen The Tinder Swindler , FYRE, or The Wizard of Lies you know fraud is an infinitely repeating social struggle that leaves the most vulnerable to pay the price. The Risk team at Sendwave builds and supports everything needed to aggregate the individual fraud cases and stop the scheme from ever being lucrative for the fraudster.

Being the Risk Product Manager will include many typical tasks like exploring vendor tools, coordinating large projects across teams and communicating the status of fraud throughout the company. However, a successful Risk Product Manager will be the creative genius behind the next generation of user verification techniques.

After the targeted Data Science defenses have detected a potential fraud case the user has the opportunity to move through one of our verification processes and unblock themselves, typically this looks like submitting an ID or speaking with a Support Rep. We would like to expand our suit of verification techniques by 5x through:

  • creative understanding of our fraudsters
  • careful rollout and rollback verification processes
  • a data-based understanding of the effectiveness
  • “User Self-Serve” automations wherever possible

Want to learn more about our hiring process for this role? Please access our HIRING PLAYBOOK HERE

What you bring to the table:
  • Clear communication skills and understanding of how to implement new experiments, making complex tradeoffs about what’s best for our users and our business thoughtfully and collaboratively.
  • A love for solving hard puzzles with solutions that make others question your mental sanity.
  • a knack for tinkering with A/B testing, statistical analysis, and other quantitative techniques to understand how we can optimize and improve key business metrics.
  • A degree (or equivalent experience) in a quantitative or technical field such as statistics, math, economics, and computer science. Sharp data analytics skills (including SQL) are critical.
  • Strong project management skills and can plan, coordinate, and track multiple experiments simultaneously.
  • A willingness to travel four weeks out of the year to meet with your team and the rest of the company (global pandemics permitting).

 

Bonus points if you have:
  • a creative approach to challenges.
  • the ability to pick up new concepts quickly.
  • flexibility and the ability to handle ambiguity gracefully.
Let's talk about the benefits. Here are a few perks you can look forward to:
  • Location: Our company is 100% remote. You can be based anywhere in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France, Germany, Belgium, Poland, Kenya, Rwanda, Senegal, or South Africa. We will consider contractors in countries not listed on a case-by-case basis.
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Major benefits:
    • Subsidized health insurance and retirement contribution matching (both vary from country to country)
    • 26 weeks of fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance
    • Unlimited vacation with a 20-day minimum requirement
    • $10,000 annual charitable donation matching
And best of all:
  • Our team of over 400 employees is fully distributed across the world. We are working from coffee shops, homes, and co-working spaces — making us one of the larger fully distributed growth-stage startups in the world.
  • We are proud parents, community organizers, farmers, band members, yoga teachers, YouTube influencers, former Olympians, and serial entrepreneurs.
  • We collectively speak over twenty languages, including Akuapem, Amharic, Bengali, Ewe, Fante, Ga, Igbo, Kalenjin, Luganda, Oromo, Somali, Swahili, Wolof, Bulgarian, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, English, Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Irish, Italian, Latvian, Lithuanian, Maltese, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish and Swedish.
  • We recently joined forces with WorldRemit, another remittance company. We’re excited about the ways we can collaborate and continue to provide the best service to our users.
Ready to apply?

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. If interested, please submit your resume along with a cover letter highlighting why your experience demonstrates you meet the requirements of the role. Please also indicate the countries in which you have work authorization.

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. Sendwave is a place where everyone can thrive. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to wake up every day.

Principal Product Manager

Location: Remote

 

Job Summary

TCGplayer connects hobbyists and hobby businesses to communities. We relentlessly improve the exchange of things and thoughts that fuel passions, providing the most compelling destination and tools for collectible card game enthusiasts, sellers, and publishers in the U.S. Now we’re expanding our innovative products and services to the global $25B collectible hobby market.

As Principal Product Manager, you will leverage your past experience and success to act as a thought leader and driving force for one of TCGplayer’s critical product portfolios, intersecting customer needs with our business goals and aligning cross-departmental teams to deliver valuable results every day. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and evaluate initiatives that enhance our customers’ lives.

Our team prides itself on a culture that fosters camaraderie, embraces diversity, and exudes passion. We are one of New York State’s 50 best employers and Fortune.com’s top 100 companies for women in the U.S. 

If you like delighting customers across the collectibles community and can clearly and persuasively articulate “Why” something must get done, this is the job for you.  

Impact You Will Make Here

Your insight, effort, and experience will contribute across 3 areas of responsibility:

  • Customer value: Evaluate, document, and socialize portfolio-level customer needs, value propositions, and user journeys; weight and prioritize competing user needs / values; define user stories, epics, experiential goals, and behavioral success requirements; integrate program-level roadmaps into a coherent, customer-focused portfolio and clearly communicate the “why” behind it.

  • Business impact: Lead Portfolio ROI definitions and business and financial modeling processes; monitor portfolio performance, anticipating and addressing business impacts; lead evaluations, decisions, and modifications on pricing models and sources of revenue; socialize plans, progress, and outcomes at every level of the business.

  • Coordinated execution: Foster an environment where cross-team collaboration and proactive communication is second nature, working closely with technical, design, and business teammates to elicit solutions that meet our customers’ needs, business goals, and internal team requirements; establish a transparent change management process, ruthlessly prioritizing to balance customer needs with operational constraints.

What You Bring to the Team

Your past experience should include accountability for program- and portfolio-level strategy and successful execution:

  • 10+ years of experience working as a Product Manager, designing and developing software solutions at a B2C company.
  • Mastery of product management and development methodologies, including Agile and contemporary customer- and design-centric practices, including the ability to establish standards and conventions for informed decisions, dependency management, and portfolio delivery.
  • Proficiency with quantitative reasoning and modeling, including metric-informed decisioning, portfolio pricing and revenue models, and designing project- to portfolio-level operating metrics and KPIs.
  • A relentless focus on customers and solving their needs, with experience deriving objectives from customer insights; a desire to regularly, directly interact with customers, and when appropriate, travel to meet with them, visit hobby stores, conventions, and TCGplayer HQ to gather a deep understanding of the hobbyist community.
  • A self-directed practice and ability to achieve results while proactively seeking out discussion and feedback from leadership, peers, and other team members on major deliverables, portfolio planning, and team processes.
  • Experience with product lines analogous to TCGplayer: primarily ecommerce marketplace and SMB SaaS experience (supply chain, data analytics, content, mobile apps, and finance and customer service tooling experience is also valuable).
  • Excellent communications skills with the ability to share complex concepts to a variety of audiences, both with internal team members and external customers; a bias towards operational scalability and documentation.
  • Strong technical skills with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development, mobile and web technologies, and data platforms; comfort with infrastructure and internal systems considerations for successful product development programs.
  • Undergraduate and/or graduate degrees in business, computer science, design, or related experience.

 

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience in a hobby, gaming, and/or collectibles community
  • Product management experience on a platform, marketplace, or other commerce product
    • Product Owner, Product Manager, or Scrum Master certification
What We Provide

Our benefits program is one of the most flexible and progressive in the country. Plus, benefits start on day one, so you have everything you need to make a stress-free transition to life at TCGplayer.

  • Comprehensive medical insurance with a variety of plan options to suit your needs
  • Dental and vision insurance
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO)
  • 100% company paid Family Leave
  • 401k plan with 4% match 
  • Free coaching, counseling and mental health services
  • 100% company paid life insurance 
  • Paid trips to work with remote teammates

 

TCGplayer.com is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

TCGplayer is the largest marketplace for trading card games in the world, with nearly 1 billion dollars in sales. Founded by Chedy Hampson & Ray Moore as a digital media platform within the collectible hobby space, we have grown from our initial roots working inside Syracuse-based hobby stores selling comic books, sports cards, CD’s, collectible cards, action figures, and tabletop games, into an expansive eCommerce marketplace that connects a global community of millions of buyers with tens of thousands of retailers. TCGplayer maintains the largest authoritative database of historical and current prices for the most popular trading card games, and this data powers and connects an entire industry of publishers, buyers, sellers, influencers & developers.

We have been ranked amongst New York State’s 50 best employers and Fortune.com’s top 100 companies for women in the U.S and certified a Great Place to Work by our employees 5 years in a row. Our entire team prides itself on creating a culture that fosters camaraderie, embraces diversity, and exudes passion. We believe every team member contributes to our success.

With the largest marketplace for collectible card games, in-store tools for local gaming stores and industry leading fulfillment center to deliver products from sellers to buyers, we bring our innovative technologies and customer focused approach to the $25B global collectibles hobby market.
